component.name: Tally for Plausible
component.summary: Simple and privacy-friendly alternative to Google Analytics

description.p: Hybrid native + web app for Plausible Analytics, the lightweight and open-source website analytics tool. Tally wraps the Plausible web app in a native UI, integrating better with desktop operating systems. Native features include:

ul.li: Icon in your App Grid, Applications Menu, Dash, Dock, etc.
Native header bar with buttons for account settings and logging out
Save and restore current view and size when closed and re-opened
Two-finger swipe and mouse button support to go back/forward between views
Cross-desktop light/dark style support for GNOME, elementary OS, etc.
Pinch-to-zoom
Set the scaling with Ctrl+Plus/Minus or Ctrl+0 to reset
Slimmed down web app UI (no header or footer with external links)
Custom domain support (e.g. self-hosted, not on plausible.io)
Support for opening external links

description.p: New icon thanks to Micah Ilbery! Rather than use the Plausible icon, Tally now has its own identity.
Say hello to Tally for Plausible: new name, same great app
This nifty Plausible app is now known as Tally for Plausible to better distinguish it from Plausible Analytics itself. Also in this release:

ul.li: Account settings and logging out are now accessed from the menu instead of their own icon on the header bar
A slightly refreshed look and feel that is more accessible and blurs the lines even further between web and native app
Added a confirmation dialog for logging out
More information added to the About window
Feeling adventurous? The web inspector and developer tools are accessible when Tally is run from a terminal

description.p: Custom domain support! Find the option in the new settings menu to use a self-hosted Plausible instance.

ul.li: Refreshed UI using the latest GNOME design style
Improved performance, especially when using power saver or lower-specced hardware

description.p: Under-the-hood update to prepare for custom domains
Fix background color of loading screen

ul.li: Fresh look with a purple headerbar and rounded corners on all platforms
Support dark style preference
More consistent animations
Visual style and libraries updated
